questions.question: I knew ………………………. I had made a mistake.
questions.description: We use that to introduce a noun clause.

questions.question: ……………………….. we heard the noise, we ran out of the house.
He worked hard ………………………….. he could earn enough to make a living.
…………………………. I get a day off, I will visit my parents.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: He died in the town ………………………….. he was born.
questions.description: We can use where to introduce adverb clauses of place.

questions.question: ………………………….. the soldiers were poorly armed, they offered a stubborn resistance.
questions.description: We use although and though to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He spends more ………………………….. he earns.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: …………………………. you mend your ways, you will land in trouble.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: ………………………… you work conscientiously, you will achieve success.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: The washing machine ………………………… I bought yesterday is energy efficient.
questions.description: Both which and that can refer to objects in identifying relative clauses.

questions.question: He went home …………………………… he was bored.
